title: Darken text contrast color in landing page ICP teaser section

requirements.text:
In LandingPage.tsx, find the paragraph element located at XPath /html[1]/body[1]/div[1]/div[1]/main[1]/div[1]/section[1]/div[3]/div[1]/p[1] (the first

inside the third div of the ICP teaser section) and apply a darker text color so it meets sufficient contrast against its background. Use a dark, high-contrast color class (e.g., text-gray-900 in light mode, or an equivalent dark foreground token) to ensure legibility.
acceptanceCriteria: The targeted paragraph text is visibly darker and clearly readable against its background.
The contrast ratio meets WCAG AA minimum (4.5:1) for normal text.
No other text elements on the page are unintentionally affected.

constraints: Only modify the specific paragraph element identified by the XPath: /html[1]/body[1]/div[1]/div[1]/main[1]/div[1]/section[1]/div[3]/div[1]/p[1]
Do not alter layout, spacing, or font size of the element.
nonGoals: Changing contrast of any other text elements on the page.
Redesigning the ICP teaser section layout.
